docs.title: 📘 DBMS Notes
docs.text: Welcome to my Database Management Systems (DBMS) notes! This site is organized into 5 units with detailed topics and explanations.

docs.title: 📑 Units
docs.text:
!!! note "Unit 1: Introduction to DBMS" Go to Unit 1 — Learn about DBMS basics, data models, and architecture.

!!! tip "Unit 2: Relational Model" Go to Unit 2 — Understand relations, keys, constraints, and ER diagrams.

!!! info "Unit 3: SQL & Query Processing" Go to Unit 3 — Dive into SQL commands, joins, and query optimization.

!!! warning "Unit 4: Transaction Management" Go to Unit 4 — Learn about transactions, ACID properties, and concurrency.

!!! success "Unit 5: Database System Architectures" Go to Unit 5 — Explore DBMS architectures, distributed DBs, and storage.

docs.title: 📢 Announcement
docs.text: !!! info "Announcement" This is an open source website. Feel free to explore and contribute!

docs.title: What is a DBMS?
docs.text: A Database Management System (DBMS) is software that allows users to store, organize, and retrieve data efficiently.
